snippet: The mayor has asked school officials to come up with “a radically different plan” under which students would be assigned to schools as close to home as possible.
abstract: Boston is working to reduce its reliance on busing in a school system that is now made up largely of minority students, four decades after court-ordered busing desegregated its public schools; court-ordered busing ended more than two decades ago, but city still buses 64 percent of its students in kindergarten through eighth grade to schools outside their immediate neighborhoods.
lead_paragraph: The mayor has asked school officials to come up with “a radically different plan” under which students would be assigned to schools as close to home as possible.

headline.seo: New Boston Busing Debate, 4 Decades After Fervid Clashes
headline.main: 4 Decades After Clashes, Boston Again Debates School Busing
